abstract.text: A quantity sample type that measures the user’s heart rate.

inlineContent.text: These samples use count/time units (described in
Heart rate samples may include motion context information, which is stored as metadata using the
key. The value of this key is an
The motion context gives additional information about the user’s activity level when the heart rate sample was taken. Apple Watch uses the following guidelines when setting the motion context:
If the user has been still for at least 5 minutes prior to the sample, the context is set to the
If the user is in motion, the context is set to the
You can add motion context to the metadata of any heart rate samples that you create. This means other apps may also save heart rate samples with (or without) the
Note that not all heart rate samples have a motion context. For example, if Apple Watch cannot determine the motion context, it creates samples without a

metadata key. In addition, heart rate samples recorded by an Apple Watch (1st generation) or by a device running watchOS 3 or earlier do not have the motion context metadata key. Treat these samples as if they used the

abstract.text: An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A category sample type for high heart rate events.
A category sample type for irregular heart rhythm events.
A category sample type for low heart rate events.
A correlation sample that combines a systolic sample and a diastolic sample into a single blood pressure reading.
A series sample containing heartbeat data.
A type that identifies samples containing electrocardiogram data.
Values that indicate the user’s level of activity when the heart rate sample was measured.
A value indicating that the user was in motion during the heart rate sample.
A value indicating that the user’s activity level could not be determined.
A value indicating that the user has been still for at least 5 minutes prior to the heart rate sample.
The user’s activity level when the heart rate sample was measured.
The location where a specific heart rate reading was taken.
An object that stores a value for a given unit.
Constant values that describe how quantities can be aggregated over time.
A sample that represents a quantity, including the value and the units.
The identifiers that create quantity type objects.
A quantity type that measures an estimate of the percentage of time a person’s heart shows signs of atrial fibrillation (AFib) while wearing Apple Watch.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s diastolic blood pressure.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s systolic blood pressure.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s body temperature.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s heart rate.
A quantity sample that records the reduction in heart rate from the peak exercise rate to the rate one minute after exercising ended.
A quantity sample type that measures the standard deviation of heartbeat intervals.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s oxygen saturation.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s resting heart rate.
A quantity sample type that measures the user’s heart rate while walking.
A class for managing the units of measure within HealthKit.
Read series data from condensed workouts.
Track a workout on Apple Watch.
